futur.note: Regular future stem 'penser-': je penserai, tu penseras, il/elle pensera, nous penserons, vous penserez, ils/elles penseront. As a regular -er verb, 'penser' follows predictable conjugation patterns across all tenses: présent (je pense, nous pensons), imparfait (je pensais, nous pensions), futur simple (je penserai, nous penserons), and passé composé with 'avoir' (j'ai pensé). Common uses: 'penser à quelqu'un/quelque chose' (to think about someone/something), 'penser que + indicative' (to think that - expressing opinion), 'penser de' (to think of/about - asking for opinion as in 'Que penses-tu de...?'), 'penser faire quelque chose' (to think of doing something/to plan to do something), 'sans penser' (without thinking), 'faire penser à' (to remind of), 'je pense que oui/non' (I think so/I don't think so). Note: 'penser à' means to think about (have in one's thoughts), while 'penser de' is used to ask for an opinion. The verb 'penser' can also mean to believe or to have an opinion.
